author: Kat Oak
title: Maize & Blue Scholar White's Boeing internship transformed career trajectory
text:
Maize & Blue Scholar White's Boeing internship transformed career trajectory
Kat OakOn
[Skip to Article Text](#mainArticleText)Share or print this article
Questions. The past few years have brought a couple of important ones to the forefront for University of Michigan-Flint senior Alexander White.
"I'm the kind of person who worries a lot about the future—will I be able to get a good job? Will I be prepared for what comes next? You know, I think with my experiences graduating from high school during the COVID-19 pandemic, there was a lot of uncertainty. I felt a lot of pressure to choose the right path," said White, who was recently named a Fall 2024 Maize & Blue Distinguished Scholar and will graduate Dec. 15 with a bachelor's in business administration operations and supply chain management and a minor in Spanish.
"I initially chose to attend UM-Flint because of its affordability and proximity to home, but the incredible support I received during my first two years made me realize it was a great long-term decision."
After beginning his college studies early while attending high school in Grand Blanc, White first experimented with different majors and classes, struggling to find the right path. "Ultimately, I knew I wanted to work for a manufacturing company in a job that allowed me to travel and explore international opportunities," he said. "I connected early with the former career development manager at the School of Management, who was integral in helping me find my way. I gained a lot of confidence through the different workshops he offered, so when Boeing came to the career fair last year, I was very prepared to connect with them and advocate for an internship."
For current and future students at UM-Flint, White stressed how vital the career service support he received has been in preparing him for his future. "All students, no matter their major, should connect early and often with the folks in Career Services," he said. "You don't know what a job will be like until you do it, so take advantage of their expertise! They are there to help you succeed."
White spent the summer of 2024 working in the Seattle-area, putting the skills and ideas he'd learned in his courses at UM-Flint into practice. "It was the perfect experience! I spent most of my time at the Boeing Everett Factory offices, visited suppliers in Washington and California, and attended intern networking events they hosted, so I learned a lot," he said. "It also showed me how supply chain management connects with all levels of a business, so there is a lot of opportunity for growth and development in my career."
His experiences at Boeing led directly to him securing a position with Parker Hannifin's Supply Chain Leadership Development Program, which he'll begin shortly after graduation. "They liked that I had hands-on experience in the aerospace industry, and it turned out that I had also worked with one of their subsidiaries during my internship at Boeing, so that was a real plus," said White. "The skills I've developed at UM-Flint, in terms of core business practices and professionalism, have truly prepared me to make the most of this opportunity. Being named a Maize & Blue Scholar is one more thing I can add to my resume, and I think it will have a long-term positive impact on my career."
White is keeping an open mind when considering his future career trajectory. "I'd like to work in this field for a while and then maybe go to law school, perhaps get into corporate law, with some experience in these industries under my belt," he said. "And, eventually, I'd like to own my own business—but that might be, you know, 20 or 30 years from now! I'm focused on building a solid foundation, and UM-Flint has helped me get a great start."
Kat Oak
Kat Oak is the communications specialist for the College of Arts, Sciences, and Education. She can be reached via email at [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection).

author: Shashank Didmishe
title: Union Budget: Union Budget focus on job creation: Salesforce India | Pune News - Times of India
text: Pune: The upcoming Union Budget for 2024-25 will likely focus on job creation and the govt is expected to provide initiatives to stimulate work opportunities, veteran banker and current chairperson and CEO of Salesforce India, Arundhati Bhattacharya said. “I think the govt is looking at jobs from whatever the poll outcome has been and the experts have been saying,” she said on the sidelines of a press conference organised by the US-based SaaS firm. Bhattacharya stressed the need for developing sectors that are labour intensive areas so that the govt can upskill the workforce and create the infrastructure in those areas. There are lots of areas that the govt can focus on ranging from tourism, health to life sciences, she added. Infrastructure-heavy sectors such as housing and roadways contribute significantly to the economy in addition to job creation. The housing sales continue to witness record growth across all major metros in the post pandemic period, however, growth in the affordable segment is lagging. On the regulation of in the fintech sector in India, Bhattacharya said that in order to become sustainable, there should be self-regulation or regulation imposed by regulators. Earlier, micro loans were introduced was self-regulated but people were driven by death traps and then regulators had to step in. “Basically, what we are looking at is assessment of risks. If you are able to do that you will not get in trouble with the regulators,” she added.We also published the following articles recentlyEU regulator has a warning for Nvidia: We have beenLearn about the European Union's scrutiny of tech giant Nvidia for potential market risks related to AI chip supply. Regulatory authorities are monitoring the situation closely, but no action has been decided upon. author: EIN News
title: J Blanton Plumbing Stands Ready to Help Chicago Flood Victims After Torrential Rains - Business News Today - EIN Presswire
text:
J Blanton Plumbing Stands Ready to Help Chicago Flood Victims After Torrential Rains J. Blanton Plumbing — expert plumbing, local care, right when you need it.
Ron Thomas of J Blanton Plumbing talks to CBS News Chicago about emergency plumbing and flood-prevention after heavy West Side flooding.
Following reports of severe flooding from CBS News, local plumbing experts urge residents to protect homes and share strategies to mitigate water damage.
We want people to know we’re ready to respond day or night with licensed, experienced plumbers who know exactly how to deal with these emergencies.” — Aizik Zimerman NORTHBROOK, IL, UNITED STATES, July 10, 2025 / EINPresswire.com / -- As torrential rains flood homes on Chicago’s West Side—highlighted in a recent CBS News Chicago report —J Blanton Plumbing is stepping up to support affected residents with essential flood-prevention guidance and emergency plumbing services.
Heavy storms this week have inundated streets and basements, leaving many homeowners battling standing water, sewer backups , and extensive property damage. The CBS News story shows West Side residents struggling to clear inches of water from their living spaces—a scene all too familiar to Chicagoans during severe weather.
“Flooding like this is devastating,” said Aizik Zimerman, Owner of J Blanton Plumbing. “We’ve served Chicago neighborhoods for over 30 years, and every time heavy rain hits, we see the same problems: overwhelmed drains, failed sump pumps, and sewer backups that could often be prevented with maintenance or early intervention.”
J Blanton Plumbing is encouraging Chicago homeowners to take these steps immediately:
- Test sump pumps to ensure they’re operational.
- Clear exterior drains and gutters to reduce water pooling near foundations.
- Consider installing a backwater valve to help prevent sewer backups.
- Schedule professional inspections to catch issues before the next storm.
For homes already dealing with flooding, J Blanton Plumbing is offering 24/7 emergency service across the Chicago area, including the West Side, North Side, and surrounding suburbs.
“Chicago weather can turn in an instant,” Zimerman added. “We want people to know we’re ready to respond day or night with licensed, experienced plumbers who know exactly how to deal with these emergencies.”
J Blanton Plumbing has been a trusted local provider since 1993, known for transparent pricing, expert repairs, and commitment to keeping Chicago homes safe and dry—even in the toughest storms.
Residents looking for help can visit jblantonplumbing.com or call 773-923-2106 to schedule service or request emergency support.Cynthia Wozniak
J. Blanton Plumbing

author: Soham Mukherjee
title: Where to watch PBKS vs DC IPL match online, free live stream, TV and telecast details for Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals today
text:
Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals will face off in their opening encounter on Saturday, March 23 at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Chandigarh. This marks the first time that the venue will host an IPL match, adding to the novelty and anticipation surrounding the fixture.
Punjab Kings, with only one top-five finish since their runner-up position in 2014, aim to turn the tide in IPL 2024. Led by Shikhar Dhawan, the team retains a familiar squad from the previous season.
With Dhawan and England's Jonny Bairstow leading the batting order, Punjab Kings hope for an improved performance. Their bowling attack boasts talent like Nathan Ellis, Kagiso Rabada, Arshdeep Singh, and Harshal Patel, known for their wicket-taking abilities.
BET NOW: Exclusive sign-up offers and bonuses when you bet on IPL action
Whereas, under coach Ricky Ponting, Delhi Capitals anticipate a strong performance. Despite the abundance of overseas talent, including Australians like Jhye Richardson, the return of skipper Rishabh Pant is a significant boost. Pant's innovative style and leadership add depth to the team. Additionally, players like Marsh, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Kuldeep Yadav are in top form, providing further strength to the squad.
When will the IPL 2024 match between Punjab Kings & Delhi Capitals be played?
The match between Punjab Kings & Delhi Capitals will take place on Saturday, March 23. It is slated to kick off at 3:30 pm.
Where will the IPL 2024 match between Punjab Kings & Delhi Capitals be played?
The match between Punjab Kings & Delhi Capitals will be played at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Chandigarh in Mullanpur.
Which TV channels will broadcast the Punjab Kings & Delhi Capitals IPL 2024 match?
The Punjab Kings & Delhi Capitals IPL 2024 match live telecast in India will be available across Star Sports channels.

author: Roberto Leiva
title: Futbolista chilena quien se desmayó, quedó en coma
text:
La delantera chilena de 18 años Natsumy Millones , promesa de la selección juvenil del país austral, se se entró en coma inducido este jueves, horas después de que se desmayara durante un entrenamiento del equipo, informó su club Coquimbo Unido.
La futbolista experimentó convulsiones tras su desvanecimiento en la práctica del miércoles y debió ser internada en el Hospital San Pablo de la ciudad de Coquimbo, ubicada a 460 kilómetros de Santiago, donde permanece con respiración mecánica.
“Nuestra jugadora, Natsumy Millones, continúa hospitalizada bajo sedación hasta evaluar su estado con mayor certeza. Entendemos que esta situación clínica se mantendrá durante los próximos días con el objetivo de favorecer su estabilización”, anunció el cuadro pirata en un comunicado.
Foto: X La futbolista se encontraba entrenando en el Complejo Deportivo Las Rozas en la preparación de su equipo para el inicio de la liga femenina en marzo, cuando le sobrevino el colapso que fue atendido por los médicos del club que luego debieron trasladarla a urgencias.
La delantera ya había vivido una situación similar con la selección chilena durante su participación en el Sudamericano Sub-17 realizado en Paraguay el año pasado. En esa oportunidad, se desvaneció en pleno partido y abandonó el campo en ambulancia.
Millones enfrenta una condición neurológica preexistente para la cual estaba medicada y se encontraba a la espera de una cirugía, según reseña la prensa chilena, pero afirman que tenía autorización médica para realizar actividad física.
La atacante, una de las jóvenes promesas del fútbol femenino chileno, participó con La Roja en el Mundial Sub-17 de 2022 que se jugó en India.
Con Coquimbo Unido, equipo del norte de Chile, se convirtió en la primera jugadora con contrato profesional a los 16 años, tras la promulgación de la Ley de Profesionalización del Fútbol Femenino en 2022.
Con el cuadro ‘Pirata’ jugó las semifinales del campeonato femenino de forma consecutiva en 2023 y 2024 y antes había logrado el ascenso en 2022.
Desde las redes sociales de la selección chilena enviaron un mensaje de aliento para la futbolista.
“Desde la familia de la Roja le mandamos mucha fuerza y entereza tanto para ella como para sus cercanos. ¡Todos la familia del fútbol, profesionales, cuerpos técnicos, jugadoras y jugadores de la Federación de Fútbol de Chile estamos contigo, Natsumy!”, expresaron.
VOLVER A PORTADA

author: Milly Veitch For Mailonline
title: Joel Dommett 'pockets a whopping £2,500 every DAY' after scoring huge presenting gigs on ITV's The Masked Singer and the BBC's Survivor | Daily Mail Online
text: Joel Dommett is certain to be riding high, as he reportedly earned £2,500 a day this year, thanks to bagging huge presenting gigs. The TV presenter, 38, has landed several major roles in recent years, presenting ITV 's The Masked Singer as well as BBC show Survivor. And his efforts appear to be paying off, as The Sun reports that his private firm funds have doubled in the past year. His performing arts firm, Neon Hero, reported its earnings on Companies House, revealing Joel raked in £2.3million over the last 12 months in comparison to £1.4m the year before. The company has £1,108,653 in cash, as well as £980,832 in investments and £251,916 in monies owed. Joel Dommett is certain to be riding high, as he reportedly earned £2,500 a day this year, thanks to bagging huge presenting gigs (pictured last month) The TV presenter, 38, has landed several major roles in recent years, presenting ITV 's The Masked Singer as well as BBC show Survivor (pictured on The Masked Singer last month) And his efforts appear to be paying off, as The Sun reports that his private firm funds have doubled in the past year (pictured in May) The Sun adds that Joel retained £2,090,625 in profits at his firm, including £814,831 for the year, which is more than ten times higher than the £71,096 profit made in 2022. Joel set up Neon Hero in 2012, and its first trading profit in 2013 was reported as £13,944, before shooting up to £2.3 million in 10 years. It staggering pay-check report comes after it was revealed that Joel's earnings are only set to rise even higher after he was announced to have landed a major role hosting a new game show on Netflix . While the details of the show have not been revealed, Joel started filming the programme in an East London TV studio earlier this month, according to The Sun . It's fair to say that given comedian Joel will be the host, viewers should expect something with a comical twist. A TV insider told the publication: 'Joel is one of the most in-demand presenters right now and this just proves it. 'It's rather unprecedented to be the star man across three networks but clearly he's doing something right. Joel is really excited by the new show.' Joel began his career as a stand-up comedian before scoring several presenting gigs, but hit the big-time after starring on I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! in 2016. His performing arts firm, Neon Hero, reported its earnings on Companies House, revealing Joel raked in £2.3million over the last 12 months in comparison to £1.4m the year before It staggering pay-check report comes after it was revealed that Joel's earnings are only set to rise even higher after he was announced to have landed a major role hosting a new game show on Netflix He bagged the presenting role on The Masked Singer in 2020, as well as sister show The Masked Dancer the following year and has hosted the last three National Television Awards He became a fan favourite and went on to present the spin-off show I'm a Celebrity: Extra Camp from 2017 to 2019. He bagged the presenting role on The Masked Singer in 2020, as well as sister show The Masked Dancer the following year and has hosted the last three National Television Awards. It's been a huge year of success all round for Joel, as he a nd his wife Hannah Cooper, 34 , also welcomed their first child in September . Joel and Hannah had kept their baby's sex a secret throughout pregnancy but revealed they had welcomed a son named Wilde on Instagram. Wrapped up in a blanket, Hannah shared a snap of her baby boy's feet and wrote: 'Wilde Cooper-Dommett. Pinterest perfect baby feet that are already bigger than his Dad’s.' Speaking about becoming a dad, Joel told The Mirror in October: 'It's amazing, it's everything everyone says it will be and more. Nothing can prepare you for it. But we're very happy as our new little family and Hannah has been beyond amazing.' author: Petersen Dawson
title: CWA expresses deep disappointment over massive layoffs at Microsoft - Aroged
text: Microsoft’s recent decision to cut 650 jobs in its gaming division has sparked a wave of criticism from the Communications Workers Union (CWA). The organization, which previously supported Microsoft’s merger with Activision Blizzard, is now expressing deep disappointment with the tech giant’s actions. Microsoft to cut gaming staff by 650 CWA representatives stressed the paradox of the situation: one of the most profitable corporations in the world, which earned $88 billion last year, resorts to mass layoffs under the pretext of ensuring “long-term success.” Such a move, according to the union, runs counter to expectations from a company of such size and financial power. What makes the situation particularly bitter is that the CWA was instrumental in getting regulators to approve the Microsoft-Activision Blizzard deal. The union took this step after Microsoft entered into a union-neutrality agreement that paved the way for unionization at major gaming studios. Samuel Cooper, senior producer of World of Warcraft and a member of WoWGG-CWA, expressed solidarity with the fired colleagues. He called on workers in the gaming industry to join unions to protect their rights and interests. The CWA reminded that while union representation cannot always prevent layoffs, it can strengthen workers’ bargaining power with their employers. Despite its disappointment with Microsoft’s actions, the CWA said it remains committed to supporting the company’s workers in their quest for better working conditions. The union will continue to organize workers and protect their rights, especially in light of the increasing number of layoffs in the tech industry.

title: 新能源车电池ETF（159775）跌0.36%，半日成交额76.23万元|新能源车_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，新能源车电池ETF（159775）跌0.36%，报0.560元，成交额76.23万元。新能源车电池ETF（159775）重仓股方面， 比亚迪 截止午盘跌1.40%， 宁德时代 跌1.13%， 亿纬锂能 涨0.35%， 三花智控 涨3.26%， 华友钴业 跌0.69%， 赣锋锂业 跌0.45%， 格林美 跌0.97%， 欣旺达 跌0.86%， 国轩高科 涨0.73%， 先导智能 跌1.97%。
新能源车电池ETF（159775）业绩比较基准为 国证新能源车电池指数 收益率，管理人为建信基金管理有限责任公司，基金经理为龚佳佳，成立（2022-01-07）以来回报为-43.82%，近一个月回报为-3.07%。

author: iheart.com
title: 31 Workers Escape Tunnel Collapse in Wilmington | KFI AM 640
text:
Photo: PATRICK T. FALLON / AFP / Getty Images
In Wilmington, Los Angeles, a tunnel collapse on Wednesday night led to a tense but successful rescue of 31 workers. The incident occurred around 8 p.m. in the 1700 block of N. Figueroa Street, involving workers in a six-mile-long tunnel located 400 feet underground. The tunnel is part of the Clearwater Project, designed to transport treated wastewater to the ocean.
According to the Los Angeles Times , more than 100 Los Angeles Fire Department personnel, including Urban Search and Rescue teams, responded to the scene. The workers managed to escape by climbing through the collapsed section of the tunnel. Interim Fire Chief Ronnie Villanueva described it as a "very scary" situation, but fortunately, no one was injured.
Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass met with the rescued workers and expressed relief at the positive outcome, saying, "I am feeling very good that this is a great outcome to what started as a very scary evening." The collapse occurred over five miles from the tunnel's entry point, as reported by CBS4 Local .
The tunnel, part of a $630.5 million project, was expected to reach Royal Palms Beach by the end of the year. However, the construction is now paused as the contractor assesses the damage and determines necessary repairs. Robert Ferrante, chief engineer for the L.A. County Sanitation Districts, stated that the timeline for resuming work is uncertain.
The LAist reported that the project aims to safely transport treated water from the Hyperion Water Reclamation Plant to the Pacific Ocean. The incident is the first major setback since construction began in 2019.
